parameters.jsonBody:

"query": "(Sophos OR HPE OR Veeam OR Fortinet OR Cisco OR Ansible OR Kubernetes OR SolarWinds OR Acronis OR Juniper OR Huawei OR Broadcom OR Chrome OR Edge OR Outlook OR Dell OR IBM OR Hitachi OR Pure OR Mikrotik OR Ubiquiti OR PFSense) AND lastseen:[ {{ $json.last_seen }}] order:published",
  "skip": 0,
  "size": 5,
  "fields": ["id", "published", "description", "short_description", "type", "title", "cvelist", "href", "sourceHref", "sourceData", "cvss", "lastseen"],
  "apiKey": "QXJ8W19OX7DSLVL5G5G41DY2E5CSNV6YN1G0DC6ER1CNRKF7PF4E9SPN1WI3UFN1"
}

options.systemMessage:
ERES UN AGENTE ESPECIALIZADO EN CIBERSEGURIDAD Y TRADUCCI√ìN T√âCNICA. DISPONES DE LA HERRAMIENTA `SearchCVEWeb` PARA BUSCAR INFORMACI√ìN ACTUALIZADA EN L√çNEA SOBRE CUALQUIER CVE. TU TAREA CONSTA DE DOS FASES: --- ## üìå FASE 1: TRADUCCI√ìN - TRADUCE FIELMENTE EL CAMPO `"description"` AL ESPA√ëOL LATINOAMERICANO. - NO INVENTES INFORMACI√ìN NUEVA. - CONSERVA T√âRMINOS T√âCNICOS EN INGL√âS SI NO HAY EQUIVALENTE. - EJEMPLO DE T√âRMINOS QUE NO DEBES TRADUCIR: `client-side`, `server-side`, `CVSS`, `vector`. --- ## üìå FASE 2: INVESTIGACI√ìN Y RECOMENDACIONES - CONSULTA LA HERRAMIENTA `SearchCVEWeb` USANDO EL CVE COMO T√âRMINO DE B√öSQUEDA. - ANALIZA INFORMACI√ìN COMO: - BOLETINES DE SEGURIDAD - PARCHES DISPONIBLES - EXPLOITS - MITIGACIONES OFICIALES - GU√çAS DE HARDENING - ALERTAS CERT/CSIRT --- ## üìå RECOMENDACIONES: ENRIQUECIMIENTO FORZADO - SI LA VULNERABILIDAD TIENE CVSS >= 7.0, ENTREGA AL MENOS **3 RECOMENDACIONES**. - FORMATEA CADA UNA DENTRO DE UNA ETIQUETA `
  • `. - INCLUYE VARIABILIDAD: NO REPITAS EL MISMO TIPO DE ACCI√ìN. - CATEGOR√çAS DE RECOMENDACIONES A CONSIDERAR: - ‚úÖ APLICACI√ìN DE PARCHES - ‚úÖ SEGMENTACI√ìN DE RED - ‚úÖ AN√ÅLISIS DE LOGS - ‚úÖ CONTROL DE ACCESO - ‚úÖ ENDPOINT HARDENING - ‚úÖ PRUEBAS DE PENETRACI√ìN INTERNAS - ‚úÖ ACTUALIZACI√ìN DE POL√çTICAS DE SEGURIDAD --- ## üß† CADENA DE PENSAMIENTO 1. TRADUCE la descripci√≥n original. 2. CONSULTA SearchCVEWeb con el CVE. 3. ANALIZA severidad, explotaci√≥n y contexto del producto afectado. 4. SI CVSS >= 7.0, GENERA AL MENOS 3 RECOMENDACIONES DE DIFERENTES TIPOS. 5. FORMATEA cada recomendaci√≥n as√≠: `
  • Recomendaci√≥n concreta
    • `. 6. DEVUELVE EL SIGUIENTE JSON: { "descripcion": "...", "recomendaciones": "
  • ...
  • ...
  • ...
    • " } --- ## üö´ LO QUE NO DEBES HACER - NO INVENTES RECOMENDACIONES SIN USAR `SearchCVEWeb`. - NO OMITAS LAS ETIQUETAS `
  • `. - NO ENTREGUES EL RESULTADO EN FORMATO DISTINTO A JSON. - NO REPITAS LA MISMA RECOMENDACI√ìN CON DISTINTAS PALABRAS. - NO LIMITES LA SALIDA A UNA SOLA RECOMENDACI√ìN SI HAY DATOS PARA M√ÅS. --- ## üì• EJEMPLO DE ENTRADA { "description": "IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.12 could allow an authenticated user to obtain sensitive information or perform unauthorized actions on behalf of another user due to client-side enforcement of server-side security.", "cve": "CVE-2025-33137", "cvss": 7.1 }

_source.description:
The vulnerability was identified in Broadcom P225p NetXtreme-E Dual-port 10Gb/25Gb Ethernet PCIe Adapter, Broadcom NetXtreme-E family , versions 231.1.162.1 (package version), 1.10.3 (hwrm spec).

The discovered vulnerability is related to stack-based buffer overflow, which leads to arbitrary code execution on the KONG core and the possibility of compromising the entire networking adapter or even other virtual machines/hypervisors.

**Vulnerability status:** Confirmed by vendor

**Date of vulnerability remediation:** 10.04.2025

**Recommendations:**

  * Update the firmware to 2.33 or higher



**Researcher:** Alexey Kovrizhnykh (Positive Technologies)

_source.description:
The vulnerability was identified in Broadcom P225p NetXtreme-E Dual-port 10Gb/25Gb Ethernet PCIe Adapter, Broadcom NetXtreme-E family, versions 231.1.162.1 (package version), 1.10.3 (hwrm spec).

The discovered vulnerability is related to improper access control to the network adapter memory read/write debug functions.

**Vulnerability status:** Confirmed by vendor

**Date of vulnerability remediation:** 10.04.2025

**Recommendations:**

  * Update the firmware to 2.33 or higher



**Researcher:** Alexey Kovrizhnykh (Positive Technologies)
_source.title: PT-2025-17: Unrestricted memory access to internal memory of networking adapter in Broadcom P225p NetXtreme-E Dual-port 10Gb/25Gb Ethernet PCIe Adapter, Broadcom NetXtreme-E family

The discovered vulnerability is related to improper access control to the network adapter memory read/write debug functions.

_source.description:
The vulnerability was identified in Broadcom P225p NetXtreme-E Dual-port 10Gb/25Gb Ethernet PCIe Adapter, Broadcom NetXtreme-E family , versions 231.1.162.1 (package version), 1.10.3 (hwrm spec).

The discovered vulnerability is related to stack-based buffer overflow in the ChiMP core, which leads to the failure of the entire networking adapter.

**Vulnerability status:** Confirmed by vendor

**Date of vulnerability remediation:** 10.04.2025

**Recommendations:**

  * Update the firmware to 2.33 or higher



**Researcher:** Alexey Kovrizhnykh (Positive Technologies)

_source.description: A vulnerability was found in docarray up to 0.40.1. It has been rated as critical. Affected by this issue is the function __getitem__ of the file /docarray/data/torch_dataset.py of the component Web API. The manipulation leads to improperly controlled modification of object prototype attributes ('prototype pollution'). The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
_source.title: CVE-2025-5150
